subproblems.prompt: Sober Monty Hall opens door B, revealing a goat. Make a Bayes table with prior, likelihood and posterior. Use posterior probabilities to determine the best strategy.
Dizzy Monty Hall opens door B, revealing a goat. Make a Bayes table with prior, likelihood and posterior. Use posterior probabilities to determine the best strategy.
Monty is sober with probability 0.7 and dizzy with probability 0.3. Repeat the analysis.

Find the prior predictive probability that the first roll will be a 7 and the posterior (after first roll) predictive probability that the second roll will be a 7. Also find the posterior (after first roll) probabilities for the chosen die.
Find the posterior probability P(H|data) for each die given data of all n rolls. What is the limit as n -> infinity? Explain why this makes sense.
Given that first 10 rolls resulted in 7 (n=10), rank the possible values for my next roll from most likely to least likely. Note any ties and explain reasoning.
Find the posterior predictive pmf for the (n+1)st roll given the data: P(x_{n+1} | x_1=7,...,x_n=7) for x_{n+1}=1,...,20.
What function does the pmf in part (d) converge to as n -> infinity? Explain why this makes sense.

problems.title: CLT sample size
problems.prompt: Mean is mu, standard deviation is 3. Use CLT to determine smallest n for which Pr(|X_bar_n - mu| < 0.3) >= 0.95.

problems.title: CLT digit average
problems.prompt: 16 digits chosen at random with replacement from {0,...,9}. What is probability their average lies between 4 and 6?

problems.title: Bayesian posterior with uniform prior
problems.prompt: Proportion theta of defective items unknown. Prior is uniform on [0,1]. Eight items selected, exactly three defective. Determine posterior distribution of theta. Compute expected mean and variance of theta.

problems.title: Bayesian posterior with non-uniform prior
problems.prompt: Same as P5 but prior pdf is xi(theta) = 2(1-theta) for 0<theta<1. Eight items, three defective. Determine posterior distribution of theta.
